Medium Description En: Predicts fracture risk in postmenopausal women.

Full Title En: Short Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test-Geriatric Version (SMAST-G)
Medium Description En: Screens for alcohol abuse in elderly patients.
Assists with management of infants with neonatal abstinence syndrome (NAS).
Calculates rate of energy output of the heart.
Frequently used to assess neutropenic fever in chemotherapy patients.
Calculates daily energy expenditure.
Calculates the total body bicarbonate deficit.

Full Title En: Body Mass Index (BMI) and Body Surface Area (BSA)
Medium Description En: Calculates body mass index and body surface area.
Calculates a corrected calcium level for patients with hypoalbuminemia.

Full Title En: PSI/PORT Score: Pneumonia Severity Index for CAP
Medium Description En: Estimates mortality for adult patients with community-acquired pneumonia.
Before Use: Tips for COVID-19: Use after diagnosis to determine dispo. Inputs line up better with known COVID-19 risk factors; adjust for elderly.
Short Description En: Mortality in CAP: more complex than CURB-65.

Full Title En: Framingham Risk Score for Hard Coronary Heart Disease
Medium Description En: Estimates 10-year risk of heart attack.
Instructions En: There are several distinct Framingham risk models. MDCalc uses the 'Hard' coronary Framingham outcomes model, which is intended for use in non-diabetic patients age 30-79 years with no prior history of coronary heart disease or intermittent claudication, as it is the most widely applicable to patients without previous cardiac events. See the official Framingham website for additional Framingham risk models.
Short Title En: Framingham Risk Score (Hard Coronary Heart Disease)

Medium Description En: Corrects the QT interval for heart rate extremes (choose from Bazett, Fridericia, Framingham, Hodges, or Rautaharju formulas).

Full Title En: Maddrey's Discriminant Function for Alcoholic Hepatitis
Medium Description En: Suggests which patients with alcoholic hepatitis may have a poor prognosis and benefit from steroid administration.
Estimates ET tube size based on age.
Determines the cause of renal failure. Similar to the FENa, but can be used on patients on diuretics.
Short Description En: Similar to FENa; for pts on diuretics.

Medium Description En: Coma severity based on Eye (4), Verbal (5), and Motor (6) criteria.
Instructions En: Note that this calculator has been updated as of May 2019 in order to add more supporting references and to distinguish between the Glasgow Coma Score (total score, only applicable when all three components are testable) and the Glasgow Coma Scale (component scores, applicable if any of three components is not testable).

Medium Description En: Calculates LDL based on total and HDL cholesterol and triglycerides.
Instructions En: Note: the Friedewald formula is known to be inaccurate at extremely high triglyceride (>400 mg/dL) and total cholesterol levels. If there is any question about accuracy of estimated LDL, a direct level should be measured.

Medium Description En: Calculates maintenance fluid requirements by weight.
Instructions En: While originally derived in pediatric patients, this calculator is applicable to any age. Consider using ideal body weight in obese patients. If not calculating based on ideal body weight, use clinical judgment for dosing. A 1-liter bolus may be appropriate for most patients, such as overweight adolescents and adults.

Medium Description En: Calculates mean arterial pressure.
Estimates glomerular filtration rate based on creatinine and patient characteristics.
Instructions En: Only for chronic kidney disease (CKD); not accurate for acute renal failure. This calculator uses the 4-variable equation from Levey 2006, which relied on a standardized creatinine assay.
Before Use:
This calculator includes inputs based on race, which may or may not provide better estimates, so we have decided to make race optional. See here for more on our approach to addressing race and bias on MDCalc.

For the same creatinine value, this calculator estimates a higher GFR for Black patients.

Medium Description En: Quantifies end-stage liver disease for transplant planning with sodium.
Instructions En: Use in patients ≥12 years old. Note: As of January 2016, calculation of the MELD has changed. It now includes serum sodium level. See OPTN's announcement.
Before Use: We’ve updated and combined our MELD scores into one page. Clinicians can choose the formula that best fits their needs: the original MELD score; the current MELD-Na used by UNOS/OPTN, and the 2022 MELD 3.0 score. Click here to view.

Medium Description En: Predicts outcomes, especially in pediatric patients; helps determine need for ECMO.
Calculates fluid status in volume per weight & volume per weight per time, for pediatrics.
Estimates mortality of patients with pancreatitis, based on initial and 48-hour lab values.
Calculates expected serum osmolarity, for comparison to measured osmolarity to detect unmeasured compounds in the serum.
Predicts risk for serious outcomes at 7 days in patients presenting with syncope or near-syncope.
Instructions En: Use in adult patients presenting with syncope or near-syncope who are back to their neurologic baseline. Do not use in patients with persistent or new neurologic deficits, alcohol or drug-related loss of consciousness, definite seizure, or transient loss of consciousness from head trauma.

Medium Description En: Calculates sodium quantity missing in hyponatremia.
Instructions En: The hyponatremia correction rate calculator can be used to pick an appropriate fluid and volume as well.

Medium Description En: Estimates mortality in patients with STEMI.
Determines if chronic diarrhea is osmotic or secretory in nature.
Estimates mortality for patients with unstable angina and non-ST elevation MI.
Calculates free water deficit by estimated total body water.
Short Description En: Free water deficit by estimated total body water.

Medium Description En: Objectifies risk of pulmonary embolism.

Full Title En: Winters' Formula for Metabolic Acidosis Compensation
Medium Description En: Calculates the expected pCO2 compensation in a purely metabolic acidosis.
Assesses for degree of shunting and V/Q mismatch.
Estimates mortality of community-acquired pneumonia to help determine inpatient vs. outpatient treatment.
Before Use: Tips for COVID-19: Use after diagnosis to determine dispo. May have some value in COVID-19.

Medium Description En: Corrects serum phenytoin level for renal failure and/or hypoalbuminemia.
Instructions En: Use in patients with albumin ≤3.2 g/dL (32 g/L). The “Sheiner-Tozer Equation” is the official name of this correction. This updated formula uses an albumin coefficient of 0.275, and 0.2 for patients with renal failure (see Evidence for details).

Medium Description En: Estimates cirrhosis severity.
Estimates the risk of stroke after a suspected transient ischemic attack (TIA).
Short Description En: Stroke risk after TIA: inpt vs outpt.

Medium Description En: Calculates risk of DVT based on clinical criteria.
Instructions En:
• Note: The Wells' Score is less useful in hospitalized patients (Silveira PC, 2015).
  • There are a few versions of this criteria with minor differences based on the study; this set is the most widely validated, based on Wells 2003.
Short Description En: Risk of DVT based on clinical criteria.

Medium Description En: Describes criteria for knee trauma patients so low risk as not to warrant knee imaging.
Calculates pregnancy dates from last period, gestational age, or date of conception.
Instructions En:
• Enter date of last menstrual period, gestational age (on today's date or other ultrasound date), date of conception, OR estimated due date to estimate the other dates.
  • Only EDD is affected by cycle length ≠28 days when calculating from LMP, EGA, and EDC.
  • When starting with EDD, all results change depending on cycle length.
Short Description En: From LMP, EGA, or date of conception.

Full Title En: Sodium Correction Rate in Hyponatremia and Hypernatremia
Medium Description En: Calculates recommended fluid type, rate, and volume to correct hyponatremia slowly (or more rapidly if seizing).
Before Use: This dosing tool is intended to assist with calculation, not to provide comprehensive or definitive drug information. Always double-check dosing of any drug and consult a pharmacist when necessary.

Medium Description En: Stratifies upper GI bleeding patients who are "low-risk" and candidates for outpatient management.

Full Title En: King's College Criteria for Acetaminophen Toxicity
Medium Description En: Recommends who should be immediately referred for liver transplant.
Estimates viability of an extremity after trauma, to determine need for salvage vs empiric amputation.
Calculates PO/IV NAC dosing for acetaminophen overdose (and nomogram to determine toxic 4 hour level).
Criteria for which patients are unlikely to require imaging after head trauma.
Instructions En: Use ONLY in patients with head injury and loss of consciousness (LOC) who are neurologically normal (i.e., GCS 15 and normal brief neurological exam).
Short Description En: Very sensitive, rules out imaging in some.

Medium Description En: Predicts likelihood of appendicitis diagnosis.
Provides mortality estimate in patients with ACS using only blood pressure, heart rate, and age.
West Haven Criteria. Defines criteria for the stages of hepatic encephalopathy.
Short Description En: West Haven Criteria: Severity to guide treatment.

Medium Description En: Quantifies croup severity (although mainly used for research, not clinically).
Predicts mortality in patients with alcoholic hepatitis by lab results and age.
Quantifies severity of trauma injuries based on GCS, blood pressure, and respiratory rate.
Instructions En: Use the first set of data obtained on the patient.

Medium Description En: Clinically clears cervical spine fracture without imaging.
Short Description En: More sens/spec, but more complex, than NEXUS.

Medium Description En: Clears patients from cervical spine fracture clinically, without imaging.
Defines when knee x-rays are unnecessary, based on the Pittsburgh rules.

Full Title En: SIRS, Sepsis, and Septic Shock Criteria
Medium Description En: Defines the severity of sepsis and septic shock.
Instructions En:
Note: sepsis definitions are evolving and difficult to finalize without a gold standard. These criteria are what is reported and the literature is listed, but note that nuances exist for all sepsis definitions and can differ locally, regionally, nationally, and internationally, as well as in clinical vs administrative vs research settings. Sepsis-3 Consensus Definitions are frequently cited as one paradigm.

For patients under 18, please use the Pediatric SIRS, Sepsis, and Septic Shock Criteria.
Short Description En: Defines severity of sepsis and septic shock.

Full Title En: GRACE ACS Risk and Mortality Calculator
Medium Description En: Estimates admission to 6 month mortality for patients with acute coronary syndrome.
Predicts need for massive transfusion in trauma patients.
Short Description En: Need for massive transfusion; calculated before labs.

Medium Description En: Predicts the need for massive transfusion based on clinical and laboratory data.
Short Description En: Need for massive transfusion; calculated after labs.

Medium Description En: Standardizes severity of traumatic injury based on worst injury of 6 body systems.
Instructions En: Rate only the most severe injury from each body system. Used primarily in research settings, so calculation of the ISS should not delay initial management of patients with traumatic injuries.

Medium Description En: Predicts 30-day outcome of patients with PE, with fewer criteria than the original PESI.
Predicts 30-day outcome of patients with pulmonary embolism using 11 clinical criteria.
May be a more sensitive indicator of occult shock, especially in trauma or acute hemorrhage.
Evaluates states of metabolic acidosis.
Instructions En: We now have an ABG Analyzer to help with acid-base analysis as well.

Medium Description En: Rules out clinically significant foot and ankle fractures to reduce use of x-ray imaging.
Short Description En: Rules out clinically significant foot and ankle fractures.

Medium Description En: Objectifies degree of depression severity.
Before Use: MDCalc provides tools and content intended for use by healthcare professionals, and is not meant for use by patients. While these may be surveys or questions intended for patients, they are meant to be answered in the context of a clinician’s medical care and not on their own to diagnose or treat any disease.

Medium Description En: Measures severity of anxiety.
Before Use: MDCalc provides tools and content intended for use by healthcare professionals, and is not meant for use by patients. While these may be surveys or questions intended for patients, they are meant to be answered in the context of a clinician’s medical care and not on their own to diagnose or treat any disease.

Medium Description En: Screens for excessive drinking and alcoholism.

Full Title En: Adult Self-Report Scale (ASRS v1.1) for ADHD
Medium Description En: Diagnoses adult ADHD.
Instructions En: This is intended for patients ≥18 years old.

Medium Description En: Diagnostic criteria for endocarditis.

Full Title En: Sgarbossa's Criteria for MI in Left Bundle Branch Block
Medium Description En: Criteria to diagnose acute MI in patients with prior LBBB.

Full Title En: LRINEC Score for Necrotizing Soft Tissue Infection
Medium Description En: Screens for necrotizing soft tissue infections.
Instructions En:
If high suspicion for necrotizing fasciitis through clinical history and physical exam, do not calculate a LRINEC score and go straight to operative debridement.
Note: Use with caution, as the LRINEC Score has performed poorly in external validation, most recently in Neeki 2017.

Medium Description En: Predicts mortality risk in pancreatitis with fewer variables than Ranson's.
Instructions En: Data should be taken from the first 24 hours of the patient's evaluation.

Medium Description En: The CIWA-Ar objectifies severity of alcohol withdrawal.
Interprets ABG.
Instructions En: This analyzer should not substitute for clinical context. Sodium and chloride are required for anion gap calculation.

Medium Description En: Adds sodium to the MELD model for liver cirrhosis.
Instructions En: Note: The Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network recently incorporated sodium into their new MELD Score as of January 2016, using a different model than MELD-Na. We recommend using the new MELD Score primarily.
Before Use: We’ve updated and combined our MELD scores into one page. Clinicians can choose the formula that best fits their needs: the original MELD score; the current MELD-Na used by UNOS/OPTN, and the 2022 MELD 3.0 score. Click here to view.

Full Title En: Index of Severity for Eosinophilic Esophagitis (I-SEE)
Medium Description En: Classifies severity of eosinophilic esophagitis (EoE).
Instructions En: This is one of the first scores created to calculate the disease severity of eosinophilic esophagitis (EoE). You’ll need the patient's history of symptoms, along with their most recent EGD and pathology reports to use this score.

Full Title En: Emergency Heart Failure Mortality Risk Grade (EHMRG)
Medium Description En: Estimates 7-day mortality of emergency CHF patients.
Instructions En: This score is not intended for use in dialysis-dependent patients.

Medium Description En: Shortened, validated version of the NIHSS.
Instructions En: Note: numbering scheme is intentional and reflects differences from the original NIHSS (i.e., 1A, 7 and 10 are eliminated, and 3 and 4 are combined).

Full Title En: Opioid Risk Tool (ORT) for Narcotic Abuse
Medium Description En: Estimates risk of opioid-related aberrant behaviors.
Instructions En: This tool studied patients at a chronic pain clinic.

Full Title En: CRUSADE Score for Post-MI Bleeding Risk
Medium Description En: Stratifies bleeding risk after NSTEMI.

Full Title En: RIETE Score for Risk of Hemorrhage in Pulmonary Embolism Treatment
Medium Description En: Determine the risk of major bleeding during anticoagulant therapy.
Differentiates patients with HIT from those with other causes of thrombocytopenia.

Full Title En: HIT Expert Probability (HEP) Score for Heparin-Induced Thrombocytopenia
Medium Description En: Pre-test clinical scoring model for HIT based on broad expert opinion.
Identifies febrile infants ≤90 days old at low risk of invasive bacterial infections.
Instructions En: Use in previously healthy infants ≤90 days old presenting with fever without a source.

Medium Description En: Distinguishes septic arthritis from transient synovitis in a child with an inflamed hip.
Short Description En: Septic arthritis vs transient synovitis in pediatric inflamed hip.

Full Title En: Surgical Apgar Score (SAS) for Postoperative Risk
Medium Description En: Predicts postoperative risk of major complication, including death.
Simplifies assessment of head trauma patients compared to the GCS.
Instructions En: Score the patient's best response.

Medium Description En: Rates level of anxiety based on clinical questions.
Screens for depression based on clinically significant questions.
Rates depression symptoms via self-assessment, also known as QIDS-SR-16.
Identifies chest pain patients who are low risk and safe for early discharge.
Short Description En: 2-hour rule out for low risk chest pain.

Full Title En: ADAPT Protocol for Cardiac Event Risk
Medium Description En: Assesses chest pain patients at 2 hours for risk of cardiac event.
Short Description En: 2-hour rule out for low risk chest pain.

Full Title En: Emergency Department Assessment of Chest Pain Score (EDACS)
Medium Description En: Identifies chest pain patients with low risk of major adverse cardiac event.
Short Description En: Identifies low risk chest pain, longer but more specific than HEART.

Full Title En: Confusion Assessment Method for the ICU (CAM-ICU)
Medium Description En: Establishes ability to detect delirium in high risk settings.
Ranks agitation and possibility for sedation.
Instructions En: See Evidence for definitions of criteria.

Full Title En: Modified Rankin Scale for Neurologic Disability
Medium Description En: Measures the degree of disability or dependence in the daily activities of people who have suffered a stroke or other causes of neurological disability.

Full Title En: DRAGON Score for Post-TPA Stroke Outcome
Medium Description En: Predicts 3 month outcome in ischemic stroke patients receiving TPA.
Short Description En: Calculate before tPA; predicts long term outcome.

Full Title En: Barnes Jewish Hospital Stroke Dysphagia Screen
Medium Description En: Assesses ability to swallow without aspiration after stroke.
Short Title En: Barnes Jewish Hospital Stroke Dysphagia Screen

Full Title En: Pediatric SIRS, Sepsis, and Septic Shock Criteria
Medium Description En: Defines the severity of sepsis and septic shock for pediatric patients.
Instructions En: Note: There is still debate about how to define pediatric sepsis given varying ranges of “normal” vital signs for ages. For patients over 18, please use the Adult SIRS, Sepsis, and Septic Shock Criteria.

Medium Description En: Quantifies severity of opiate withdrawal.

Full Title En: DASH Prediction Score for Recurrent VTE
Medium Description En: Predicts likelihood of recurrence of first VTE.
Instructions En: Do NOT use in patients with active hemorrhage or signs/symptoms of VTE.
Short Description En: Predicts likelihood of recurrence of first VTE.

Medium Description En: Identifies at-risk drinkers (i.e., binge drinking) who may not be alcohol-dependent.
Short Description En: Screens for at-risk drinkers, not necessarily dependence.

Full Title En: POMPE-C Tool for Pulmonary Embolism Mortality
Medium Description En: Predicts mortality for cancer patients with PE.

Full Title En: Padua Prediction Score for Risk of VTE
Medium Description En: Determines anticoagulation need in hospitalized patients by risk of VTE.
Short Description En: Inpatient risk of VTE, need for anticoagulation.

Medium Description En: Predicts mortality in patients with Alcoholic Hepatitis not responding to steroid therapy.
Instructions En: The Lille Model risk stratifies patients already receiving steroids for alcoholic hepatitis treatment for 7 days to predict which will not improve and should be considered for other management strategies. All values besides 7-day bilirubin are taken from admission.
Short Description En: Mortality in Alcoholic Hepatitis that's unresponsive to steroids.

Full Title En: HAT (Hemorrhage After Thrombolysis) Score for Predicting Post-tPA Hemorrhage
Medium Description En: Assesses hemorrhage risk after tPA.

Full Title En: ABC/2 Formula for Intracerebral Hemorrhage Volume
Medium Description En: Predicts volume of intracranial hemorrhage from CT measurements.
Instructions En: Measure length and width on the CT slice with the largest area of hemorrhage. NOTE: CT slices are typically measured in mm, not cm.

Medium Description En: Converts steroid dosages using dosing equivalencies.
Instructions En: These dose relationships only apply to oral or IV administration. Glucocorticoid potencies may differ greatly following intramuscular or intra-articular administration.

Full Title En: STONE Nephrolithometry Score for Renal Calculi
Medium Description En: Predicts recurrence of kidney stone based on radiological criteria.
Detects urine acidosis for evaluation of non-gap metabolic acidosis.
Short Description En: Detects urine acidosis for metabolic acidosis eval.

Full Title En: UCSF-CAPRA Score for Prostate Cancer Risk
Medium Description En: Predicts outcomes of patients post-treatment for prostate cancer.
Assesses urinary incontinence symptoms and monitors outcomes with treatment.
Instructions En: After asking: Do you experience and if so how much are you bothered by:

Medium Description En: Prognoses prostate cancer based on microscopic tumor appearance.

Full Title En: D'Amico Risk Classification for Prostate Cancer
Medium Description En: Assesses 5 year risk of treatment failure based on clinical factors.
Short Description En: Assesses 5 year failure of prostate CA treatment failure.

Medium Description En: Calculates urine output over a 24-hour period.
Instructions En: Include volume intake to get a net fluid balance calculation as well (assuming no other fluid losses), for both adult and pediatric patients.

Full Title En: NEXUS Chest Decision Instrument for Blunt Chest Trauma
Medium Description En: Determines which patients require chest imaging after blunt trauma.
Instructions En: Applies to patients ≥15 years old with blunt trauma within the past 24 hours in the ED. May be used sequentially with NEXUS Chest CT Decision Instrument (see Next Steps for details).

Medium Description En: Measures prostate tumor volume and PSA density.

Full Title En: Kruis Score for Diagnosis of Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
Medium Description En: Determines presence of IBS using clinically significant weighted criteria.

Full Title En: Manchester Score for Prognosis in Small Cell Lung Cancer
Medium Description En: Predicts 2 year survival of small cell lung cancer.
Short Description En: 2 year survival of small cell lung CA.

Full Title En: Sokal Index for Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia (CML)
Medium Description En: Predicts survival of CML based on clinical and lab information.
Instructions En: Use to predict prognosis at the time of CML diagnosis, before starting treatment.

Medium Description En: Rates critically ill patients’ pain based on clinical observation.

Full Title En: Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS) / Functional Systems Score (FSS)
Medium Description En: Describes severity of disability in patients with MS.

Full Title En: GAP Index for Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF) Mortality
Medium Description En: Provides 1, 2, and 3-year mortality estimates for IPF patients.
Stages breast cancer based on tumor, lymph nodes, and metastases.
Instructions En: This calculator is based on the 7th edition of the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. An update based on the 8th edition is currently in progress.

Medium Description En: Risk stratifies for gout vs non-gout arthritis and helps determine which patients benefit most from joint aspiration.

Full Title En: Disease Activity Score-28 for Rheumatoid Arthritis with ESR (DAS28-ESR)
Medium Description En: Describes severity of rheumatoid arthritis using clinical and laboratory data, specifically ESR.

Full Title En: Clinical Disease Activity Index (CDAI) for Rheumatoid Arthritis
Medium Description En: Determines severity of rheumatoid arthritis using only clinical data.

Full Title En: Disease Activity Score-28 for Rheumatoid Arthritis with CRP (DAS28-CRP)
Medium Description En: Describes severity of rheumatoid arthritis using clinical and laboratory data, specifically CRP.

Full Title En: Simple Disease Activity Index (SDAI) for Rheumatoid Arthritis
Medium Description En: Determines severity of rheumatoid arthritis using clinical and laboratory data.
Measures the impact fatigue takes on a patient's daily life.
Instructions En: The shortened version of the MFIS can also be used when assessing daily fatigue impact of MS.

Medium Description En: Shorter version of MFIS which measures the impact fatigue takes on a patient's daily life.
Instructions En: The shortened version of the MFIS uses questions 1, 9, 10, 17, and 19 from the longer version of the MFIS.

Medium Description En: Evaluates MS disease progression based on patient’s ambulatory ability.
Noninvasive estimate of liver scarring in HCV and HBV patients, to assess need for biopsy.
Estimates risk of 5-year all-cause mortality in patients with HIV and/or HCV.
Short Description En: All-cause mortality for patients with HIV or HCV.

Medium Description En: Determines probability of HIV patients developing CKD in the next 5 years, if they take tenofivir or not.
Short Description En: 5 year likelihood of CKD in HIV.

Medium Description En: Assesses number of lymphocytes and predicts CD4 count.
Before Use: Tips for COVID-19: Use after diagnosis to determine dispo. Lymphopenia appears to be a predictor of COVID infection.

Medium Description En: Estimates overall survival based on clinical information.

Full Title En: Groupe d'Etude des Lymphomes Folliculaires (GELF) Criteria
Medium Description En: Determines if immediate therapy for follicular lymphoma is required.

Full Title En: Atropine Dosing for Cholinesterase Inhibitor Toxicity
Medium Description En: Doses atropine for cholinesterase inhibitor toxicity (prescribed drugs, nerve gas, insecticides).
Instructions En:
• Use in patients with cholinergic toxicity to determine atropine bolus dose and continuous infusion rate.
  • Not for use in treating isolated bradycardia.
  • Not for use in AtroPen Atropine Auto-Injector dosing.
  • In the United States, the local Poison Control Center can be reached at 1-800-222-1222 to help guide management.
Before Use: This dosing tool is intended to assist with calculation, not to provide comprehensive or definitive drug information. Always double-check dosing of any drug and consult a pharmacist when necessary.

Full Title En: MELD Score (Original, Pre-2016, Model for End-Stage Liver Disease)
Medium Description En: Quantifies end-stage liver disease for transplant planning.
Instructions En: Note: This is the pre-2016 MELD which does not include serum sodium level, as non-US transplant societies are still using the original MELD formula. The newer MELD Score is listed as “MELD Score”.
Before Use: We’ve updated and combined our MELD scores into one page. Clinicians can choose the formula that best fits their needs: the original MELD score; the current MELD-Na used by UNOS/OPTN, and the 2022 MELD 3.0 score. Click here to view.

Full Title En: TNM Staging for Renal Cell Carcinoma
Medium Description En: Stages RCC based on tumor, lymph nodes, and metastases.
Instructions En: This calculator is based on the 7th edition of the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. The 8th edition is now recommended for use over this version.

Full Title En: NAFLD (Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease) Fibrosis Score
Medium Description En: Estimates amount of scarring in the liver based on several laboratory tests.
Determines the likelihood of hepatic fibrosis and cirrhosis in patients with hepatitis C.
Short Description En: Predicts hepatitis C-related hepatic fibrosis and cirrhosis.

Medium Description En: Defines presence of portal hypertension in patients with ascites.
Short Description En: Defines presence of portal hypertension in patients with ascites.

Full Title En: Revised Original Score for Autoimmune Hepatitis (AIH)
Medium Description En: Revised version of the original scoring system for the diagnosis of autoimmune hepatitis.
Short Description En: Revised version of the original scoring system for autoimmune hepatitis.

Medium Description En: Predicts mortality at 6 months in patients with infective endocarditis.

Full Title En: CEDOCS Score for Emergency Department Overcrowding
Medium Description En: Estimates severity of overcrowding in community emergency departments.
Short Description En: Estimates severity of overcrowding in community EDs.

Full Title En: NEDOCS Score for Emergency Department Overcrowding
Medium Description En: Estimates severity of overcrowding in emergency departments.

Full Title En: PEDOCS Score for Pediatric Emergency Department Overcrowding
Medium Description En: Estimates severity of overcrowding in pediatrics emergency departments.
Short Description En: Estimates severity of overcrowding in peds EDs.

Full Title En: Alberta Stroke Program Early CT Score (ASPECTS)
Medium Description En: Determines MCA stroke severity using available CT data.
Instructions En: To compute the ASPECTS, 1 point is subtracted from 10 for any evidence of early ischemic change for each of the defined regions.

Full Title En: Rome III Diagnostic Criteria for Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
Medium Description En: Official Rome III criteria for the diagnosis of irritable bowel syndrome.
Instructions En: Recurrent abdominal pain or discomfort, 3 days per month in the last 3 months (12 weeks), associated with ≥2 of the criteria below. The criteria are fulfilled with symptoms onset 6 months prior to diagnosis.

Medium Description En: Diagnoses appendicitis with lab values and clinical findings, especially for Asian populations.
Short Description En: Diagnoses appendicitis with lab values and clinical findings.

Full Title En: Manning Criteria for Diagnosis of Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
Medium Description En: Determines likelihood of irritable bowel syndrome diagnosis based on clinically significant criteria.
Determines ability of patient to tolerate chemotherapy.
Instructions En: For patients ≥ 16 years old. Useful to use over time to track disease progression.

Full Title En: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
Medium Description En: Determines ability of patient to tolerate therapies in serious illness, specifically for chemotherapy, simpler than the Karnofsky Scale.
Short Description En: Chemotherapy tolerance, simpler than the Karnofsky Scale.

Full Title En: Lansky Play-Performance Scale for Pediatric Functional Status
Medium Description En: Uses parent description of child’s activity to assess ability and response to treatment.
Instructions En: For patients < 16 years old. Useful to use over time to track disease progression.

Full Title En: Clinical Pulmonary Infection Score (CPIS) for Ventilator-Associated Pneumonia (VAP)
Medium Description En: Assists in diagnosing ventilator-associated pneumonia by predicting benefit of pulmonary cultures.
Instructions En: Many reviews of the CPIS feel it should not be relied on; we include it because of its popularity but caution users to review the data on its utility first.
Short Description En: Diagnosis of VAP by predicting benefit of pulmonary cultures.

Full Title En: Rome II Diagnostic Criteria for Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
Medium Description En: Official Rome II criteria for the diagnosis of irritable bowel syndrome.
Instructions En: The Rome IV Criteria are now recommended as an update to these criteria (May 2016).

Medium Description En: Identifies patients who do not require intensive care for their first episode of acute pancreatitis.
Short Description En: Rules out ICU need for first episode of acute pancreatitis.

Full Title En: Glasgow-Imrie Criteria for Severity of Acute Pancreatitis
Medium Description En: Determines severity of pancreatitis based on 8 laboratory values.
Instructions En: These criteria are traditionally scored with values at 48 hours after admission.

Full Title En: Glasgow Prognostic Score (GPS) for Cancer Outcomes
Medium Description En: Provides cancer prognosis based on serum biomarkers.
Instructions En: Note: We recommend the Modified Glasgow Prognostic Score over this original version.

Medium Description En: Predicts cancer mortality from serum biomarkers.
Stages pancreatic cancer based on tumor, lymph nodes, and metastases.
Instructions En: This calculator is based on the 7th edition of the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. The 8th edition is now recommended for use over this version.

Full Title En: Khorana Risk Score for Venous Thromboembolism in Cancer Patients
Medium Description En: Predicts risk of VTE for cancer patients depending on type of cancer and other factors.
Instructions En: Use in general cancer patients (i.e., solid tumors and lymphomas). Do not use in patients with brain tumors or myelomas.
Short Description En: Predicts risk of VTE for cancer patients.

Medium Description En: Predicts likelihood of strep throat.

Full Title En: VBAC Risk Score for Successful Vaginal Delivery (Flamm Model)
Medium Description En: Predicts likelihood of successful vaginal birth after previous caesarean section (VBAC).
Short Description En: Quantifies likelihood of vaginal birth after previous C-section.

Full Title En: Bishop Score for Vaginal Delivery and Induction of Labor
Medium Description En: Predicts likelihood of successful vaginal delivery.
Determines likelihood of pediatric patients developing childhood asthma.
Instructions En: This score applies to pediatric patients ≤3 years old.

Medium Description En: Predicts future asthma in pediatric patients.
Instructions En: This score applies to pediatric patients ≤3 years old.

Full Title En: Pediatric Asthma Severity Score (PASS) for Asthma Exacerbation Severity
Medium Description En: Determines pediatric asthma severity based on physical exam findings.
Instructions En: Applicable to pediatric patients 1-18 years of age.

Full Title En: Pediatric Respiratory Assessment Measure (PRAM) for Asthma Exacerbation Severity
Medium Description En: Measures severity of airway obstruction in pediatric patients using clinical observations.
Instructions En: The PRAM has been used in patients 3-17 years old and works best to evaluate improvement of symptoms pre- and post-treatment.

Full Title En: Prevention and Incidence of Asthma and Mite Allergy (PIAMA) Risk Score
Medium Description En: Determines risk of asthma for school age children.
Short Description En: Risk of asthma for school age children.

Medium Description En: Predicts likelihood of asthma exacerbation within 6 months.

Full Title En: ASCVD (Atherosclerotic Cardiovascular Disease) 2013 Risk Calculator from AHA/ACC
Medium Description En: Determines 10-year risk of heart disease or stroke.
Instructions En: Our ASCVD Risk Algorithm is a step-wise approach for all adult patients – including those with known ASCVD. This calculator is for use only in adult patients without known ASCVD and LDL 70-189 mg/dL (1.81-4.90 mmol/L).
Before Use:
This calculator includes inputs based on race, which may or may not provide better estimates, so we have decided to make race optional. See here for more on our approach to addressing race and bias on MDCalc.

For the same other inputs, this calculator estimates higher cardiovascular risk for African American patients.

Full Title En: ASCVD (Atherosclerotic Cardiovascular Disease) Risk Algorithm including Known ASCVD from AHA/ACC
Medium Description En: Determines 10-year risk of heart disease or stroke and provides statin recommendations.
Before Use:
This calculator includes inputs based on race, which may or may not provide better estimates, so we have decided to make race optional. See here for more on our approach to addressing race and bias on MDCalc.

For the same other inputs, this calculator estimates higher cardiovascular risk for African American patients.
Short Description En: 10-year heart disease or stroke risk and statin recommendations.

Medium Description En: Determines what immunizations/vaccinations are due based on a patient's age.
Instructions En: This is based on the CDC's dosing schedule. Clinical judgment and knowledge of past vaccinations should guide decision to provide vaccinations to patients.

Full Title En: Nonverbal Pain Scale (NVPS) for Nonverbal Patients
Medium Description En: Quantifies pain in patients unable to speak (due to intubation, dementia, etc).
Instructions En: One can also use the Behavioral Pain Scale (BPS) for Intubated Patients as an alternative to the NVPS.
Short Description En: Pain scale in patients unable to speak.

Full Title En: Behavioral Pain Scale (BPS) for Pain Assessment in Intubated Patients
Medium Description En: Quantifies pain in intubated patients.
Instructions En: One can also use the Nonverbal Pain Scale (NVPS) for Nonverbal Patients as an alternative to the BPS.

Full Title En: Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario Pain Scale (CHEOPS) for Post-Op Pediatric Pain
Medium Description En: Quantifies pain post-operatively in pediatric patients 1-5 years old.
Instructions En: One can also use the Behavioral Observational Pain Scale (BOPS) for Post-Op Pediatric Pain as an alternative to the CHEOPS.

Full Title En: Behavioral Observational Pain Scale (BOPS) for Post-Op Pediatric Pain
Medium Description En: Quantifies post-operative pain for children aged 1-7 years.
Instructions En:
This pain scale is for use in patients 1-7 years old.

One can also use the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario Pain Scale (CHEOPS) for Post-Op Pediatric Pain as an alternative to the BOPS.

Medium Description En: Quantifies severity of neuropathic pain.
Instructions En: Scores are based on patient responses to questions about pain intensity. 0 indicates no pain; 10 indicates the most pain imaginable. The NPS is only for use in patients who have already been diagnosed with neuropathic pain, and should not be used to determine IF a patient's pain is secondary to neuropathy.

Full Title En: Abbey Pain Scale for Dementia Patients
Medium Description En: Assesses pain in patients with advanced dementia.

Full Title En: Rockall Score for Upper GI Bleeding (Complete)
Medium Description En: Determines severity of GI bleeding.
Instructions En: Use this score for known upper GI bleed patients with a completed endoscopy. Use the Pre-Endoscopy Rockall Score for patients who have not yet had endoscopy.

Full Title En: Rockall Score for Upper GI Bleeding (Pre-Endoscopy)
Medium Description En: Determines severity of GI bleeding, prior to endoscopy.
Instructions En: Use this score for upper GI bleed patients who have NOT yet had endoscopy. Use the Complete Rockall Score for patients who have had endoscopy.
Short Description En: Determines severity of GI bleeding, prior to endoscopy.

Full Title En: Gail Model for Breast Cancer Risk
Medium Description En: Estimates risk for breast cancer based on demographic and clinical data.
Instructions En: The Gail Model is for use in women with no history of breast cancer, DCIS or LCIS. Other tools may be more appropriate for women with known mutations in BRCA1, BRCA2, or other hereditary syndromes associated with breast cancer. See the Evidence section for more information.
Before Use: This calculator includes inputs based on race, which may or may not provide better estimates; this calculator can be run with Race as “Unknown,” but users should know this defaults to the “White” option. Our evidence section reviews some of the issues with Race in this model. See here for more on our approach to addressing race and bias on MDCalc.
Short Title En: Gail Model for Breast CA Risk
Short Description En: Breast CA risk based on demographic and clinical data.

Full Title En: Mayo Score/Disease Activity Index (DAI) for Ulcerative Colitis
Medium Description En: Assesses severity of ulcerative colitis.

Full Title En: Revised Natural History Model for Primary Sclerosing Cholangitis
Medium Description En: Estimates survival from primary sclerosing cholangitis.
Short Title En: Revised Natural History Model for PSC

Full Title En: Pain Assessment in Advanced Dementia Scale (PAINAD)
Medium Description En: Assesses pain in patients with dementia.
Instructions En: Choose the description that best fits the patient's behavior.

Medium Description En: Assesses impaired consciousness and coma in pediatric patients.
Instructions En: Use for children 2 years and younger only. For older children, use the standard Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS). Note the difference between the Glasgow Coma Score (total score, only applicable when all three components are testable) and the Glasgow Coma Scale (component scores, applicable if any of three components is not testable).
Short Description En: Impaired consciousness and coma in pediatric patients.

Medium Description En: Diagnoses heart failure based on major and minor criteria.
Instructions En: Select minor criteria ONLY if they cannot be explained by another comorbidity, e.g. dyspnea on exertion secondary to chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.

Full Title En: AIMS65 Score for Upper GI Bleeding Mortality
Medium Description En: Determines risk of in-hospital mortality from upper GI bleeding.
Short Description En: Determines in-hospital mortality from upper GI bleeding.

Medium Description En: Quantifies likelihood of underlying vascular etiology in patients with ICH.

Full Title En: MAGGIC Risk Calculator for Heart Failure
Medium Description En: Estimates 1- and 3- year mortality in heart failure.
Instructions En: Use in adult patients (≥18 years). Use with caution in patients with reduced ejection fraction (not yet externally validated in this population).

Medium Description En: Predicts 30-day readmission or death in patients on medicine and surgery wards.
Instructions En: Use in patients ≥18 years old.

Full Title En: Estimated Ethanol (and Toxic Alcohol) Serum Concentration Based on Ingestion
Medium Description En: Predicts ethanol concentration based on ingestion of alcohol.
Instructions En: Allows estimation of maximal predicted serum concentration of alcohol based on volume and concentration ingested. Assumes 0.6 L/kg volume of distribution.
Short Description En: Predicts ethanol concentration based on ingestion of alcohol.

Full Title En: Modified Bishop Score for Vaginal Delivery and Induction of Labor
Medium Description En: Predicts likelihood of successful vaginal delivery with additional parameters to the original Bishop score.
Instructions En: Replaces effacement with cervical length, increases weightedness of cervical dilation and adds additional modifiers as compared with the original Bishop Score.

Full Title En: NEXUS Chest CT Decision Instrument for CT Imaging
Medium Description En: Identifies blunt trauma patients with clinically significant thoracic injuries.
Instructions En: Use in awake, non-intubated, hemodynamically stable blunt trauma patients ≥15 years old in whom a CT chest is considered as part of the normal diagnostic evaluation.
Short Description En: Identifies clinically significant thoracic injuries in blunt trauma patients.

Full Title En: Simon Broome Diagnostic Criteria for Familial Hypercholesterolemia (FH)
Medium Description En: Diagnoses familial hypercholesterolemia (FH) based on clinical, genetic and family history.
Diagnoses familial hypercholesterolemia (FH) based on clinical, genetic and family history.
Diagnoses Kawasaki Disease.

Full Title En: US (MEDPED) Diagnostic Criteria for Familial Hypercholesterolemia (FH)
Medium Description En: Diagnoses familial hypercholesterolemia using age, family history, and total cholesterol.
Stages HCC based on tumor, lymph nodes, and metastases.
Instructions En: This calculator is based on the 7th edition of the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. The 8th edition is now recommended for use over this version.

Full Title En: Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (mRECIST)
Medium Description En: Measures treatment response, specifically to cytotoxic drugs, based on tumor shrinkage.
Instructions En:
Use in liver lesions meeting the following criteria:

  • Can be accurately measured in at least one dimension as 10 mm or more (measure longest diameter).
  • Suitable for repeat measurement.
  • Intratumoral arterial enhancement on contrast-enhanced CT or MRI.
Short Description En: Measures treatment response by HCC tumor size.

Full Title En: Barcelona-Clinic Liver Cancer (BCLC) Staging Classification and Treatment Guidelines
Medium Description En: Determines progression of disease and proper treatment course for patients with HCC.
Short Description En: Determines progression and treatment course in HCC,

Full Title En: Acute Decompensated Heart Failure National Registry (ADHERE) Algorithm
Medium Description En: Predicts in-hospital mortality in patients with heart failure (HF).
Short Description En: Predicts in-hospital mortality in acute decompensated HF.

Full Title En: Revised Cardiac Risk Index for Pre-Operative Risk
Medium Description En: Estimates risk of cardiac complications after noncardiac surgery.
Instructions En: Note: this content was updated January 2019 to reflect the substantial body of evidence, namely external validation studies, suggesting that the original RCRI had significantly underestimated the risk (see Evidence for more).
Short Description En: Risk of major cardiac event from surgery.

Full Title En: du Bois Score for Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (IPF) Mortality
Medium Description En: Determines 1-year mortality in IPF patients using PFT and clinical indicators.
Provides formal diagnostic criteria for gout.
Instructions En: The Acute Gout Diagnosis Rule can help rule in or rule out gout, reducing the need for synovial fluid in highly likely patients and encouraging a broad differential in gout-unlikely patients.

Medium Description En: Estimates prognosis after an acute ischemic stroke.

Full Title En: HEART Score for Major Cardiac Events
Medium Description En: Predicts 6-week risk of major adverse cardiac event.
Instructions En: Use in patients ≥21 years old presenting with symptoms suggestive of ACS. Do not use if new ST-segment elevation ≥1 mm or other new EKG changes, hypotension, life expectancy less than 1 year, or noncardiac medical/surgical/psychiatric illness determined by the provider to require admission.

Medium Description En: Calculates CrCl according to the Cockcroft-Gault equation.
Instructions En: For use in patients with stable renal function to estimate creatinine clearance.

Medium Description En: Assesses neonates 1 and 5 minutes after birth.
Rules out PE if no criteria are present and pre-test probability is ≤15%.
Predicts risk of venous thromboembolism in multiple myeloma.
Instructions En: This tool can be used to identify those patients with multiple myeloma who are at high risk of venous thromboembolism (VTE). Make sure you know your patient’s medication history, VTE history, and fracture history to utilize this score.

Medium Description En: Estimates 90-day mortality in lung resection patients.

Full Title En: Ideal Body Weight and Adjusted Body Weight
Medium Description En: Calculates ideal body weight (Devine formula) and adjusted body weight.
Instructions En: To calculate tidal volume by ideal body weight, use the ETT Depth and Tidal Volume Calculator.
Short Title En: Ideal Body Weight and Adjusted Body Weight

Medium Description En: Based on age and CT findings; estimates mortality.

Full Title En: Hunt & Hess Classification of Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
Medium Description En: Classifies severity of subarachnoid hemorrhage to predict mortality.
Determines the degree of illness of a patient and prompts critical care intervention.
Instructions En: The NEWS2 Score is endorsed by the NHS (UK) as an updated version of the original NEWS.

Full Title En: Modified Early Warning Score (MEWS) for Clinical Deterioration
Medium Description En: Determines the degree of illness of a patient.
Instructions En: Different institutions and regions may use different modifications of the MEWS. Verify that your institution uses the same points assignments listed here.

Medium Description En: Predicts risk of Symptomatic Intracerebral Hemorrhage (sICH) after tPA.
Instructions En: Applies to patients receiving tPA within 4.5 hours; does not apply to patients receiving endovascular treatment.

Medium Description En: Calculates the difference between bedtime and AM fasting glucoses.
Instructions En: Use this tool to determine if adding prandial insulin to an existing regimen may be appropriate in patients with Diabetes Mellitus Type II.

Medium Description En: Updates PELD model as standard for pediatric liver transplant planning.
Instructions En: This score can be used to assign priority to liver transplant candidates younger than 12 years old. It is an update to the prior PELD score and was adopted by OPTN in July 2023.

Full Title En: Thrombosis Risk Prediction Following Cast Immobilization (TRiP(cast)) Score
Medium Description En: Predicts risk of VTE in patients with lower limb trauma.
Instructions En: Use this tool to determine 3-month risk of VTE in adult patients with lower limb trauma that requires immobilization.

Medium Description En: Assesses appropriate response to anemia, frequently in sickle cell patients.
Objectifies risk of PE, like Wells' score.

Full Title En: HIV Needle Stick Risk Assessment Stratification Protocol (RASP)
Medium Description En: Quantifies HIV exposure risk by source and exposure type and need for prophylaxis.

Full Title En: Veterans Aging Cohort Study-Charlson Comorbidity Index (VACS-CCI)
Medium Description En: Estimates risk of all-cause mortality in patients with comorbidities, including non-metastatic prostate cancer.
Instructions En: This tool assists in calculating all cause mortality in the general population and in patients with non-metastatic prostate cancer.

Full Title En: CHADS<sub>2</sub> Score for Atrial Fibrillation Stroke Risk
Medium Description En: Estimates stroke risk in patients with atrial fibrillation.
Calculates the actual sodium level in patients with hyperglycemia.

Full Title En: CHA<sub>2</sub>DS<sub>2</sub>-VASc Score for Atrial Fibrillation Stroke Risk
Medium Description En: Calculates stroke risk for patients with atrial fibrillation, possibly better than the CHADS Score.
Short Description En: Stroke risk in afib; better than CHADS.

Full Title En: HAS-BLED Score for Major Bleeding Risk
Medium Description En: Estimates risk of major bleeding for patients on anticoagulation to assess risk-benefit in atrial fibrillation care.
Estimates an average glucose level from Hemoglobin A1C value.
Determines stroke risk in patients with atrial fibrillation.

Full Title En: Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center (MSKCC/Motzer) Score for Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma (RCC)
Medium Description En: Predicts survival based on clinical and laboratory data in metastatic RCC patients.
Instructions En:
• Use baseline factors at the start date of the current line of systemic therapy, except for the “time of diagnosis to systemic therapy” criterion, which is always relative to first-line therapy.

  • Always correct calcium concentration for low albumin before scoring.

Full Title En: SSIGN Score for Renal Cell Carcinoma (RCC)
Medium Description En: Predicts progression of clear cell renal cell carcinoma after radical nephrectomy.

Full Title En: Mekhail Extension of the Motzer Score
Medium Description En: Predicts metastatic renal cell carcinoma survival, more accurately than the Motzer Score.

Full Title En: IMDC (International Metastatic RCC Database Consortium) Risk Model for Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma
Medium Description En: Predicts survival in patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma treated with systemic therapy (also known as Heng criteria).
Instructions En:
• Use baseline factors at the start date of the current line of systemic therapy, except for the “time of diagnosis to systemic therapy” criterion, which is always relative to first-line therapy.

  • Use limits of normal set by the laboratory performing the tests (for hemoglobin concentration, absolute neutrophil count, platelet count, corrected calcium concentration).

  • Always correct calcium concentration for low albumin before scoring.

Full Title En: UCLA Integrated Staging System (UISS) for Renal Cell Carcinoma (RCC)
Medium Description En: Provides 5-year disease-free prognosis for localized and metastatic RCC.
Instructions En:
• Localized: Any T; N0; M0
  • Metastatic: T>0; N>1; M>1
  • For accurate staging, see the TNM Staging for RCC calculator

Full Title En: Fuhrman Nuclear Grade for Clear Cell Renal Carcinoma
Medium Description En: Provides prognostic grading system for tumor cells based on physical cellular appearance.

Full Title En: HOMA-IR (Homeostatic Model Assessment for Insulin Resistance)
Medium Description En: Approximates insulin resistance.
Predicts likelihood that biochemical thyrotoxicosis is thyroid storm.
Instructions En: Use in patients ≥18 years old with biochemical thyrotoxicosis.

Medium Description En: Determines bleeding risk for patients on warfarin.

Full Title En: HEMORR<sub>2</sub>HAGES Score for Major Bleeding Risk
Medium Description En: Quantifies risk of hemorrhage in elderly patients with AFib.
Instructions En: The HEMORR2HAGES Score was developed using ICD-9 data; while we are actively reaching out to its study authors, the terms included in the score are not defined in the study.

Medium Description En: Clears head injury without imaging.
Instructions En:
Only apply to patients with Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) 13-15 and at least one of the following:

  • Loss of consciousness.
  • Amnesia to the head injury event.
  • Witnessed disorientation.

Exclusion criteria:

  • Age <16 years.
  • Blood thinners.
  • Seizure after injury.
Short Description En: Very sensitive, rules out imaging in many.

Full Title En: Revised McDonald Criteria for Multiple Sclerosis Diagnosis
Medium Description En: Determines presence of MS using MRI findings.
Diagnoses autoimmune hepatitis.
Instructions En: Use in patients with histological evidence of hepatitis. Do not use in patients with normal histology.

Medium Description En: Predicts need for brain imaging after pediatric head injury.
Instructions En: Note: This only applies to children with GCS scores of 14 or greater.

Medium Description En: Estimates ICU mortality.
Differentiates beta thalassemia from iron deficiency anemia.
Instructions En: Use this screening tool to assist in differentiating between iron deficiency anemia (IDA) and beta thalassemia trait (BTT).

Medium Description En: Quantifies the rate at which glucose is administered intravenously.

Full Title En: International Diabetes Federation-Diabetes and Ramadan Alliance (IDF-DAR) Fasting Risk Assessment
Medium Description En: Stratifies fasting risk during Ramadan in diabetic patients.
Identifies MALT lymphoma patients at risk of poor outcomes.
Screens for undiagnosed type 2 diabetes mellitus and prediabetes.
Predicts ICU mortality based on lab results and clinical data.
Instructions En:
Welcome Sepsis-3 readers! We've also added the qSOFA Score with a summary of the new definitions and recommendations.

Use the worst value in a 24-hour period.

Medium Description En: Assesses substance use related behaviors.

Full Title En: The Sick, Control, One, Fat, Food (SCOFF) Questionnaire
Medium Description En: Screens for eating disorders.
Screens for fibrotic NASH in individuals at high risk for NAFLD.
Instructions En: This score consists of 3 lab values that are widely available outside of specialized hepatology clinics. Use it to screen for fibrotic nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) in high-risk patients.

Full Title En: Modified Glasgow Prognostic Score (mGPS) for Cancer Outcomes
Medium Description En: Provides improved cancer prognosis over the original score, based on serum biomarkers.
Instructions En: We recommend this modified version of the score over the original GPS.

Medium Description En: Describes stages of heart failure and provides recommendations for therapy by stage.
Instructions En: This tool reflects general recommendations found in the 2022 AHA/ACC/HFSA Guideline for the Management of Heart Failure. For more detailed guideline statements and advanced therapies, view the full guideline.

Medium Description En: Predicts mortality risk in patients undergoing gastric bypass surgery.
Provides Light's Criteria to help determine if pleural fluid is exudative.

Full Title En: 2012 EULAR/ACR Classification Criteria for Polymyalgia Rheumatica
Medium Description En: Classifies polymyalgia rheumatica by expert consensus recommendations.
Instructions En: This tool should only be used in patients who: are ≥50 years of age, present with bilateral shoulder pain, and who have an abnormal ESR and/or CRP.

Medium Description En: Predicts 10-year CVD risk in patients with type 2 diabetes.
Instructions En: Use this score to predict 10-year risk of cardiovascular disease in European patients under 70 years of age and who have a history of diabetes.

Medium Description En: Indicates if an ED patient qualifies for a blood culture.
Instructions En: Determines if clinician should consider obtaining a blood culture based on symptoms and clinical findings.

Medium Description En: Calculates fluid requirements for burn patients in a 24-hour period.
Instructions En: Use in adult patients with burns. Children have larger TBSA relative to weight and may require larger fluid volumes.

Medium Description En: Classifies axial spondyloarthritis according to Assessment of Spondyloarthritis International Society (ASAS) criteria.
Predicts mortality, stroke, and bleeding in patients w/ and w/out anticoagulation.
Instructions En: Use in patients with newly diagnosed atrial fibrillation (AF) to assist in determining the risks of anticoagulation therapy.

Medium Description En: Calculates the NIH Stroke Scale for quantifying stroke severity.
Instructions En:
The NIH Stroke Scale has many caveats buried within it. If your patient has prior known neurologic deficits e.g. prior weakness, hemi- or quadriplegia, blindness, etc. or is intubated, has a language barrier, etc., it becomes especially complicated. In those cases, consult the NIH Stroke Scale website. MDCalc's version is an attempt to clarify many of these confusing caveats, but cannot and should not be substituted for the official protocol.

Rules:

  • Score what you see, not what you think.
  • Score the first response, not the best response (except Item 9 - Best Language).
  • Don’t coach.

Medium Description En: Determines if renal failure is due to pre-renal or intrinsic pathology.
Instructions En: Do not use in patients taking diuretics or with known chronic kidney disease, urinary tract obstruction, or acute glomerular disease. Use FEUrea in patients on diuretics.

Medium Description En: Measures renal function.
Determines the current severity of Crohn's disease.
Instructions En: Signs, symptoms, and history should be based on the past 7 days. Note: for abdominal pain and general well-being ratings, this calculator uses an average rating per day over the past 7 days. For stools, use the total number of soft/liquid stools over the past 7 days.
Short Description En: Determines the current severity of Crohn's disease.

Medium Description En: Estimates probability that pharyngitis is streptococcal, and suggests management course.
Instructions En: Use only in patients with recent onset (≤3 days) acute pharyngitis.

Full Title En: Metroticket Calculator for Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) Survival
Medium Description En: Predicts survival for patients with HCC.
Predicts survival in heart failure.
Instructions En: Use to predict survival in patients with systolic heart failure at 1 and 5 years.

Medium Description En: Identifies high-risk patients for in-hospital mortality with suspected infection outside the ICU.
Instructions En: Use to predict mortality, NOT to diagnose sepsis, per 2021 Surviving Sepsis Guidelines.
Short Description En: In-hospital mortality in non-ICU patients with infection.

Medium Description En: Predicts in-hospital all-cause heart failure mortality.
Before Use:
This calculator includes inputs based on race, which may or may not provide better estimates, so we have decided to make race optional. See here for more on our approach to addressing race and bias on MDCalc.

For the same other inputs, this calculator estimates lower in-hospital mortality risk in Black patients.

Full Title En: Fisher Grading Scale for Subarachnoid Hemorrhage (SAH)
Medium Description En: Rates risk of vasospasm in aSAH based on amount and distribution of blood on CT.
Instructions En:
This scale only applies to aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage (aSAH). We recommend using the Modified Fisher Grading Scale based on more recent studies.

Clinician must be able to identify subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) and major neuroanatomical landmarks on head CT.

Full Title En: Modified Fisher Grading Scale for Subarachnoid Hemorrhage (SAH)
Medium Description En: States severity of SAH based on amount and type of blood on CT with associated vasospasm risk.
Instructions En:
This scale only applies to aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage (aSAH).

  • Thin SAH is classified as < 1mm in depth.
  • Thick SAH is classified as ≥ 1mm in depth.

Clinician must be able to identify subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) and major neuroanatomical landmarks on head CT.

Full Title En: Michigan Risk Score for PICC-Related Thrombosis
Medium Description En: Predicts risk of DVT in patients with peripherally inserted central catheter (PICC).
Instructions En: Use in patients ≥18 years old admitted to a medical service (i.e., not surgical). Do not use in pregnant patients.
Before Use: This calculator is not yet externally validated and should therefore be used with caution.

Medium Description En: Prognosticates the severity of multiple myeloma based on routinely obtained lab values.
Instructions En: Use only in patients recently diagnosed with multiple myeloma. Do not use in patients with relapsed myeloma, smoldering myeloma or MGUS.

Full Title En: Revised Multiple Myeloma International Staging System (R-ISS)
Medium Description En: Prognostication tool for myeloma patients based on the genetics and other routinely used lab values in conjunction with the original ISS Staging System.
Instructions En: Use only in patients recently diagnosed with multiple myeloma. Do not use in patients with relapsed myeloma, smoldering myeloma or MGUS.

Full Title En: Ottawa Subarachnoid Hemorrhage (SAH) Rule for Headache Evaluation
Medium Description En: Rules out SAH in patients with headache.
Instructions En:
This rule has very specific inclusion and exclusion criteria that must be followed closely for appropriate application:

Only apply in: Alert patients ≥15 years old, new severe atraumatic headache, maximum intensity within 1 hour.

Do not use in: Patients with new neurologic deficits, prior aneurysm, prior SAH, known brain tumors, or chronic recurrent headaches (≥3 headaches of the same character and intensity for >6 months).

Medium Description En: Assess suitability of patients for liver transplant with cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma, recommended by AASLD guidelines.
Short Description En: Assess suitability of patients for liver transplant.

Medium Description En: Predicts mortality and morbidity after cardiac surgery.
Short Description En: Predicts mortality and morbidity after cardiac surgery.

Medium Description En: Quantifies both hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis treatment adequacy.

Full Title En: Maximum Allowable Blood Loss (ABL) Without Transfusion
Medium Description En: Estimates the maximum allowable blood loss intraoperatively before transfusion should be considered.
Short Description En: Estimates maximum blood loss allowable intra-op before transfusion.

Full Title En: EUTOS Score for Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia (CML)
Medium Description En: Predicts outcomes after CML treatments, specifically adjusted for tyrosine kinase treatments.
Instructions En: Use in newly-diagnosed patients before starting therapy.

Medium Description En: Estimates functional capacity.
Instructions En: Answers are self-reported. Provides an estimate of functional capacity, and may not be as accurate as objective measurements such as exercise stress testing.

Medium Description En: Rules out bacterial meningitis.
Instructions En: Use in patients aged 29 days to 19 years with CSF WBC ≥10 cells/μL. Do not use if patient is critically ill, recently received antibiotics, has a VP shunt or recent neurosurgery, is immunosuppressed, or has other bacterial infection requiring antibiotics (including Lyme disease).

Full Title En: Barthel Index for Activities of Daily Living (ADL)
Medium Description En: Assesses functional independence, generally in stroke patients.

Full Title En: MASCC Risk Index for Febrile Neutropenia
Medium Description En: Identifies patients at low risk for poor outcome with febrile neutropenia.
Instructions En: Use in neutropenic patients (see ANC calculator) with fever at least 100.4°F (38ºC). Do not use in patients with acute leukemia undergoing induction chemotherapy or allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplant conditioning, per IDSA guidelines.
Short Description En: Low risk for poor outcome febrile neutropenia.

Medium Description En: Predicts need for intensive respiratory or vasopressor support (IRVS) in community-acquired pneumonia (CAP).
Instructions En: Use in patients ≥18 years with clinical and radiographic findings consistent with community acquired pneumonia (CAP). Does not apply to patients with significant immunosuppression.
Before Use: Tips for COVID-19: Use to determine floor vs. ICU. Perhaps best performing to predict ICU admissions for CAP, but unclear applicability in COVID/viral pneumonias/ARDS.

Medium Description En: Determines severity of heart failure and predicts in-hospital mortality.
Short Description En: Estimates heart failure severity and in-hospital mortality.

Medium Description En: Predicts survival in COPD patients.
Instructions En: Do not use in patients during acute exacerbations of COPD. Do not use to guide therapy. See When to Use for full exclusion criteria.

Full Title En: Hestia Criteria for Outpatient Pulmonary Embolism Treatment
Medium Description En: Identifies low-risk PE patients safe for outpatient treatment.
Instructions En: Use in hemodynamically stable patients with acute pulmonary embolism (PE).

Full Title En: Global Initiative for Obstructive Lung Disease (GOLD) Criteria for COPD
Medium Description En: Assesses different stages of COPD and provides treatment recommendations.
Instructions En: Use in patients >18 years of age with already-diagnosed COPD by spirometry (FEV/FVC <0.7) with baseline symptoms and lung function. Do not use to diagnose COPD and do not use in patients with acute exacerbation.

Full Title En: IMPROVE RAM (International Medical Prevention Registry on Venous Thromboembolism Risk Assessment Model)
Medium Description En: Estimates risk of VTE.

Full Title En: Forrest Classification of Upper GI Bleeding
Medium Description En: Stratifies severity of upper GI bleeding according to endoscopic findings.

Full Title En: Fong Clinical Risk Score for Colorectal Cancer Recurrence
Medium Description En: Predicts recurrence for colorectal cancer patients with liver metastasis after hepatic resection.
Predicts appendicitis in children.
Instructions En: Use for patients 3-18 years of age.

Full Title En: POSSUM for Operative Morbidity and Mortality Risk
Medium Description En: Estimates morbidity and mortality for general surgery patients.
Instructions En:
Use values at the time of surgery, not admission.

NOTE: The POSSUM should not be used for trauma patients.
Short Description En: Estimates morbidity and mortality for general surgery patients.

Full Title En: Endotracheal Tube (ETT) Depth and Tidal Volume Calculator
Medium Description En: Estimates depth of optimal ETT placement and target tidal volume by height.
Instructions En: Use in patients over 20 years old.
Short Title En: ETT Depth and Tidal Volume Calculator

Medium Description En: Predicts risk of progression of asymptomatic (smoldering) multiple myeloma to active myeloma or amyloidosis.
Short Description En: Predicts risk of progression to active myeloma or amyloidosis.

Full Title En: Australian Type 2 Diabetes Risk (AUSDRISK) Assessment Tool
Medium Description En: Estimates risk of developing type 2 diabetes, mainly in Australian patients.
Instructions En:
Not for use in people with diagnosed diabetes. Use for screening in adults ≥25 years of age.

Note: BMI, waist circumference, or both may be used as the obesity parameter. The study's authors recommend using waist circumference only, as it has the greatest discriminatory power.

Medium Description En: Determines severity of ulcerative colitis (UC) in pediatric patients.
Short Description En: Determines severity of ulcerative colitis in peds.

Full Title En: Bosniak Classification System of Renal Cystic Masses
Medium Description En: Classification and management of complex cystic renal lesions.
Instructions En:
• Initially described for computed tomography (CT), also utilized for magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).
  • Do not use for patients with a history of von Hippel-Lindau syndrome (cystic renal neoplasms in these patients are malignant clear cell renal cell carcinoma).
Short Description En: Classification and management of complex cystic renal lesions.

Medium Description En: Stratifies asthma severity in children.
Instructions En: Do not use in patients under 2 years of age, in severe distress, or with clear alternative diagnosis.

Full Title En: International Prognostic Index for Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma (IPI and R-IPI)
Medium Description En: Predicts overall and progression-free survival in DLBCL based on risk factors.
Instructions En: Note: IPI results are included for historical comparisons only. Use in CD20+ DLBCL patients. Do not use in patients with HIV, secondary malignancies, low grade lymphoproliferative disorders, or comorbidities precluding curative therapy attempt.

Medium Description En: Predicts likelihood of live birth for elective egg freezing in women.
Instructions En: Use in women age 24–44 years undergoing fertility counseling.
Before Use: This calculator is not externally validated, and as such, should be used with caution.
Short Description En: Predicts likelihood of live birth for elective egg freezing in women.

Medium Description En: Converts diltiazem from IV to oral.
Short Description En: Converts diltiazem from IV to oral.

Full Title En: CKD-EPI Equations for Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR)
Medium Description En: Estimates GFR based on serum creatinine, serum cystatin C, or both.
Instructions En:
For use in patients with stable kidney function. While the combined creatinine and cystatin C equation can add accuracy, cystatin c is not available in all laboratories and the creatinine-based equation is adequate for many clinical purposes.

2021 CKD-EPI creatinine is currently recommended by the ASN and NKF for GFR reporting in the United States.
Before Use:
The 2021 CKD-EPI equation is now the recommended standard. This version does not include race, as do the 2009 and 2012 CKD-EPI creatinine and creatinine-cystatin C equations. See here for more on our approach to addressing race and bias on MDCalc.

With the 2021 equation, for the same creatinine value, the 2021 equation will estimate a lower GFR for Black patients and a higher GFR for non-Black patients.

Full Title En: Troponin-only Manchester Acute Coronary Syndromes (T-MACS) Decision Aid
Medium Description En: Rules out acute coronary syndrome.

Full Title En: Pittsburgh Response to Endovascular therapy (PRE) Score
Medium Description En: Identifies patients with anterior circulation large vessel occlusion (LVO) strokes likely to benefit from endovascular therapy.
Instructions En: Use in patients ≥18 years old, presenting within 8 hours of symptom onset, with anterior circulation (i.e., internal carotid, M1, or M2) LVO stroke. Measure ASPECTS using most recent CT imaging data. Apply with caution to patients with baseline morbidities.

Medium Description En: May help in assessment of hyperkalemia or hypokalemia.
Predicts risk of pathologic fracture in patients with long bone metastasis.
Instructions En: Use in patients with known long bone metastasis. Do not use if history of fracture or previous irradiation.

Medium Description En: Converts between different types and routes of opiates.
Instructions En:
1. Select the opiate and route that you wish to convert from.
  2. Input the total daily dose in milligrams of the opiate you are converting from.
  3. Select the opiate you wish to convert to. The total daily dose will be displayed in the results bar.
Before Use: This calculator is for double-checking opiate conversion, and should NOT be used as the primary means for ordering.

Full Title En: ROSE (Risk Stratification of Syncope in the Emergency Department) Rule
Medium Description En: Predicts 1-month serious outcome or death in patients presenting with syncope
Short Description En: Morbidity and mortality in syncope patients.

Full Title En: CHIP (CT in Head Injury Patients) Prediction Rule
Medium Description En: Predicts intracranial traumatic CT findings in patients with minor head trauma.
Instructions En: Use in patients at least 16 years old presenting within 24 hours of blunt head trauma and GCS 13–14 (or GCS 15 with at least one of the following: LOC, short-term memory deficit, amnesia, seizure, vomiting, severe headache, intoxication, anticoagulant use or history of coagulopathy, external evidence of injury above the clavicles, neurologic deficit). Note: We recommend using the Canadian CT Head Rule over other adult head trauma decision rules, as it is the most widely validated.
Short Description En: Predicts need for CT in minor head trauma.

Full Title En: CHALICE (Children's Head injury ALgorithm for the prediction of Important Clinical Events) Rule
Medium Description En: Predicts death, need for neurosurgical intervention or CT abnormality in children with head trauma.
Instructions En: Use in children under age 16 years with history or signs of head injury. Note: We recommend using PECARN over other pediatric head trauma rules, as it is the most widely validated.

Medium Description En: Identifies acute stroke patients in the field.
Short Description En: Acute stroke diagnosis in the field.

Medium Description En: Identifies stroke patients who are candidates for thrombolysis.
Stratifies pneumonia severity in older patients.
Identifies pneumonia patients at low risk for MRSA.

Full Title En: Park Score for Drug Resistance in Healthcare Associated Pneumonia (HCAP)
Medium Description En: Predicts drug resistance in hospitalized patients with pneumonia.
Predicts mortality after hospitalization for acute ischemic stroke.
Predicts mortality and severe disability in acute ischemic stroke.
Stratifies risk of VTE in surgical patients.
Short Description En: Stratifies risk of VTE in surgical patients.

Medium Description En: Stratifies severity of status epilepticus.
Stages melanoma based on tumor, lymph nodes, and metastases.
Instructions En: This calculator is based on the 7th edition of the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. The 8th edition is now recommended for use over this version.

Full Title En: Modified Hoehn and Yahr Scale for Parkinsons Disease
Medium Description En: Grades severity of symptoms in Parkinson’s disease.

Full Title En: Schwab and England Activities of Daily Living (ADL) Scale
Medium Description En: Grades functional status in patients with Parkinson’s disease.

Full Title En: Webster Rating Scale for Parkinsons Disease
Medium Description En: Quantifies degree of disability in Parkinson’s disease.
Quantifies disability after stroke; also validated in Parkinson’s disease.
Instructions En: Note: Starting position is patient sitting on edge of bed or table without back or arm support.

Medium Description En: Predicts survival after HCT in patients with hematologic malignancies, including optional age adjustment.
Instructions En: Entering age to obtain age-adjusted HCT-CI is optional. The original HCT-CI (without age adjustment) is still considered the standard.

Full Title En: Revised International Prognostic Scoring System (IPSS-R) for Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS)
Medium Description En: Stages patients with MDS.
Instructions En: Use at the time of diagnosis, before starting treatment.

Medium Description En: Diagnoses delirium in older patients.
Calculates reference values for distance walked, as a measure of functional status.
Instructions En: Do not use if unstable angina or MI less than 1 month prior. Relative contraindications: resting HR over 120, systolic BP over 180, or diastolic BP over 100. Stop if any of the following occur: chest pain, intolerable dyspnea, leg cramps, staggering, diaphoresis, or pale appearance.

Medium Description En: Diagnoses appendicitis based on clinical and laboratory findings.
Instructions En: Use in pediatric or adult patients with suspected appendicitis (large external validation cohort included ages 2-96 years).

Medium Description En: Calculates blood flow to the brain.
Instructions En: Use in patients with an intracranial pressure monitoring device.

Full Title En: New York Heart Association (NYHA) Functional Classification for Heart Failure
Medium Description En: Stratifies severity of heart failure by symptoms.
Distinguishes Lyme meningitis from aseptic meningitis.
Instructions En: Use in pediatric patients (aged 2–18 years) in a Lyme endemic area with CSF pleocytosis, defined as CSF WBC ≥10 cells/mm³ (corrected for CSF RBC if >500 using a ratio of 1 WBC for every 500 RBC).

Medium Description En: Stratifies predicted difficulty of endotracheal intubation based on anatomic features.
Instructions En: Position patient seated upright and direct patient to open mouth and protrude tongue fully.

Medium Description En: Quantifies severity of heart failure in ACS and predicts 30-day mortality.
Diagnoses and prognoses suspected CAD based on the treadmill exercise test.
Calculates common epidemiologic values for diagnostic tests and treatments.
Instructions En: Select Diagnostic Test to calculate stats related to diagnosis (sens, spec, prevalence, LR+, LR-, PPV, NPV). Select Treatment to calculate stats related to treatment (RR, OR, ARR, RRR, NNT). If entering sens, spec, and prevalence, enter as percentages (e.g. 67%, not 0.67).
Short Description En: Sens, spec, LR+, LR-, PPV, NPV, OR, RR, ARR, NNT.

Medium Description En: Identifies ED patients with heart failure at high risk for serious adverse events.
