Full Title En: McDonald Criteria for Multiple Sclerosis (2017 Revision)
Medium Description En: Diagnoses multiple sclerosis.
Instructions En:
Changes from the 2010 McDonald Criteria:

  1. Presence of CSF-specific oligoclonal bands may now substitute for dissemination in time (DIT) even if baseline MRI findings do not meet DIT criteria.

  2. In patients with brainstem or spinal cord attacks, symptomatic lesions may now be included as MRI evidence of dissemination in space (DIS) or DIT.

  3. Cortical lesions may now fulfill MRI criteria for DIS (in addition to juxtacortical lesions).

Full Title En: PECARN Rule for Low Risk Febrile Infants 29-60 Days Old

Instructions En: Does not apply to ill-appearing infants. The rule is intended to be one-directional: it may help rule out serious bacterial infection (SBI) in patients who are “low risk”, but the converse is not true (i.e., patients who are “not low risk” by the rule do not necessarily have SBI).
Before Use: This calculator is not yet externally validated. While derived in infants aged 0-60 days, the creators recommend using this calculator only in infants aged 29-60 days (i.e., do not use in infants 28 days or younger), due to elevated herpes meningoencephalitis risk and and limited numbers of episodes of bacterial meningitis in that age group (see Pearls/Pitfalls and Creator Insights for details).
Short Description En: Serious bacterial infection risk in febrile infants 29-60 days old.

Instructions En: This tool reflects CRAFFT 2.1.

Medium Description En: Assesses beta cell secretory function in patients with diabetes/prediabetes.
Colposcopically predicts high-grade lesions (HGL) in histology.
Colposcopically predicts histological grade of premalignant cervical lesions.
Predicts risk of type 2 diabetes in previously undiagnosed patients.
Assesses illicit drug use in the past year.
Evaluates diabetes-related emotional distress.

Full Title En: HEART Pathway for Early Discharge in Acute Chest Pain
Medium Description En: Identifies emergency department patients with acute chest pain for early discharge.
Instructions En: Use in patients ≥21 years old presenting with symptoms suggestive of ACS. Do not use if new ST-segment elevation ≥1 mm or other new EKG changes, hypotension, life expectancy less than 1 year, or noncardiac medical/surgical/psychiatric illness determined by the provider to require admission.

Full Title En: Palchak (UC Davis) Rule for Pediatric Head Trauma
Medium Description En: Identifies children at low risk for brain injuries after blunt head trauma.
Instructions En: Note: We recommend using PECARN over other pediatric head trauma rules, as it is the most widely validated.

Full Title En: PELD Score (Pediatric End-Stage Liver Disease) (younger than 12)
Medium Description En: Calculates the pediatric version of the MELD score for liver cirrhosis severity and transplant planning.
Categorizes renal masses by complexity for surgical decision-making.
Instructions En: Use cross-sectional imaging (CT or MRI, not ultrasound).

Full Title En: EGSYS (Evaluation of Guidelines in SYncope Study) Score for Syncope
Medium Description En: Predicts likelihood that syncope is from cardiac cause.
Instructions En: Note: We recommend the San Francisco Syncope Rule over other syncope risk stratification scores, as it is the most widely validated.

Medium Description En: Estimates 12-month all-cause mortality in patients presenting with syncope.
Predicts risk of having previously undiagnosed type 2 diabetes.
Instructions En: Use to estimate risk that patient currently has undiagnosed diabetes (i.e., NOT future risk of developing diabetes). Study cohort involved mostly white English patients, so use with caution in other populations.

Full Title En: Diabetic Ketoacidosis Mortality Prediction Model (DKA MPM) Score
Medium Description En: Predicts in-hospital mortality in DKA.
Instructions En: Note: This calculator is not externally validated and should be used with caution. It is not intended to routinely disposition patients. The APACHE II Score may be a better mortality predictor. Use in patients with DKA.

Medium Description En: Predicts risk of undiagnosed diabetes to determine who should be screened.
Predicts 30-day serious adverse events in patients presenting with syncope.
Instructions En: Applicable to patients ≥16 years old presenting ≤24 hours of syncope. Do not use if: prolonged (>5 min) LOC, change in mental status from baseline, obvious witnessed seizure, major trauma, intoxication, language barrier, or head trauma causing LOC. This calculator is externally validated, according to data presented at the Society for Academic Emergency Medicine Annual Meeting 2018.

Full Title En: Jones Criteria for Acute Rheumatic Fever Diagnosis
Medium Description En: Diagnoses acute rheumatic fever based on major and minor criteria.
Before Use: Note: As of 2015, the Jones Criteria have been updated to include the use of doppler echocardiography. See AHA's update.

Full Title En: Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (Combined MELD)
Medium Description En: Offers multiple versions of MELD for liver transplant planning.
Before Use:
MDCalc has streamlined the MELD calculator collection.

On this page, you'll find the original MELD Score (Pre-2016), MELD Na (previously UNOS/OPTN standard), and MELD 3.0. MELD 3.0 is the current standard calculation for organ transplantation consideration in the United States and better accounts for disparities in organ allotment based on sex.

Medium Description En: Evaluates for sepsis and septic shock in children.
Instructions En: Use in pediatric patients with suspected sepsis. Age is not adjusted for prematurity and the criteria should not be used in patients who are ≥18 years of age or preterm (<37 weeks gestation at birth). The score should not be used during birth hospitalizations.

Medium Description En: Rates level of service required in emergency medicine.
Instructions En:
This guide reflects the 2023 AMA CPT Evaluation and Management (E/M) coding changes for Emergency Medicine. Definitions have been simplified and are based on the full coding guideline available here.

Click the Copy MDM button in the results box below to paste the narrative MDM (web only).

Medium Description En: Emergency department classification and management tool for adult patients (greater than 18 years old) with suspected or confirmed SARS-CoV-2 (v3.0, updated Fall 2023).
Instructions En:
• This is intended for patients 18 years and older.

  • Evidence on this topic is evolving quickly and may change.
Before Use:
Launched during COVID-19 crisis. This tool is an expert consensus flowsheet based on evidence based studies, but has not been validated as an evidence based tool itself. See more.

This ACEP ED COVID-19 Management Tool was funded in part by a cooperative agreement with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (grant number 1 NU50CK000570). The CDC is an agency within the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS). The contents of this ACEP tool do not necessarily represent the policy of CDC or HHS and should not be considered an endorsement by the Federal Government.

Medium Description En: Predicts 10-year CVD risk in older patients.
Instructions En: Use in patients ≥70 years.

Medium Description En: Classifies severity of adverse events after neurosurgery.
dropdown test

Mid descrip - HTML

Test 2

Full Title En: Embolic Stroke of Undetermined Source (ESUS) Criteria
Medium Description En: Diagnoses embolic stroke of undetermined source.
Instructions En: Use in patients with ischemic stroke only, not hemorrhagic stroke.

Medium Description En: Stratifies severity of Crohn's disease in pediatric patients.
Instructions En: Use in patients ≤19 years old.

Medium Description En: Predicts 10-year CVD risk in patients without prior CVD or diabetes.
Instructions En: Use in patients aged 40-69 years without prior CVD or diabetes.
Short Description En: 10-yr CVD risk w/out prior CVD or diabetes.

Full Title En: Cancer and Aging Research Group Chemotherapy Toxicity Tool (CARG-TT)
Medium Description En: Estimates the risk of severe chemotherapy-related side effects (Grade 3 or greater toxicity) in older cancer patients.

Full Title En: Rapid Arterial oCclusion Evaluation (RACE) Scale for Stroke
Medium Description En: Predicts large vessel occlusion (LVO) in patients with acute stroke.
Instructions En: Use in the prehospital setting (i.e., by EMS providers) in patients with stroke symptoms.
Short Description En: Predicts large vessel occlusion (LVO) in stroke patients.

Medium Description En: Screens for alcohol abuse.
Instructions En: This tool should only be used in non-geriatric populations.

Full Title En: Horowitz Index for Lung Function (P/F Ratio)
Medium Description En: Assesses lung function, particularly in intubated patients.
Before Use:
Launched during COVID-19 crisis.

Tips for COVID-19: Use to determine floor vs. ICU. Assesses lung functions, especially for patients on ventilators.

Medium Description En: Classifies peripheral spondyloarthritis according to Assessment of SpondyloArthritis International Society (ASAS) criteria.
Estimates risk of sudden cardiac death in patients with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.
Instructions En: This tool estimates the 5-year risk of sudden cardiac death in patients ≥16 years of age after their initial evaluation.

Medium Description En: Quantifies impact of COPD symptoms on patients' overall health.
Before Use: The 2023 GOLD Guidelines propose a new grouping schema based on CAT scores and exacerbations, in addition to the GOLD Grade levels. The groups “ABE” have been proposed as replacements to “ABCD”. Prospective research is ongoing.

Full Title En: Resuscitation Using ECPR During In-Hospital Cardiac Arrest (RESCUE-IHCA)
Medium Description En: Predicts the probability of death for adult extracorporeal cardiopulmonary resuscitation (ECPR).

Full Title En: Emergency Department-Initiated Buprenorphine for Opioid Use Disorder (EMBED)
Medium Description En: Assess OUD, opioid withdrawal, and treatment readiness for ED-initiated buprenorphine.
Predicts tracheostomy need in neurocritical care patients.
Instructions En: Use in patients who have had a severe stroke and who are currently in the Neurointensive Care Unit (NICU) on a ventilator.

Full Title En: Central Nervous System International Prognostic Index (CNS-IPI)
Medium Description En: Predicts relapse in the CNS in patients with diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL).
Instructions En: This calculator assists in risk stratifying patients who have been diagnosed with diffuse large B-cell lymphoma. The risk of relapse is determined by which of the three prognostic groups your patient falls into.

Full Title En: National Comprehensive Cancer Network International Prognostic Index (NCCN-IPI)
Medium Description En: Predicts survival in patients with diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL).
Instructions En: This tool helps predict prognosis for patients diagnosed with diffuse large B-cell lymphoma. It is an update to the original IPI score and enhances risk stratification for those patients who receive rituximab treatment.

Full Title En: Nomogram for Breast Cancer Brain Metastasis
Medium Description En: Predicts risk of brain metastasis in patients with stage IV breast cancer.
Before Use: This tool contains the nomogram as well as estimates for some input values. Know the limitations of nomograms prior to use.

Medium Description En: Measures asthma impairment and risk.
Instructions En: Use in patients ≥12 years who have been diagnosed with asthma.

Medium Description En: Predicts adverse pulmonary outcomes from rib fracture.
Instructions En: Use to predict adverse outcomes in patients with confirmed rib fractures on imaging.

Full Title En: Sequential Clinical Assessment of Respiratory Function (SCARF) Score
Medium Description En: Predicts adverse outcomes in critically ill rib fracture patients.
Instructions En: Use to assess management of pain in patients with acute traumatic rib fractures. If patients’ SCARF score remains >2 then increasing level of analgesia should be considered.

Medium Description En: Determines effectiveness of current migraine treatment plan.
Instructions En: This tool can be used to gauge symptom control of acute migraine therapy. There are a few validated versions of the mTOQ; we present the 4-question version below.

Medium Description En: Predicts outcome of medical therapy in severe ulcerative colitis.
Instructions En: Use this tool to predict failure of medical therapy on day 3 of admission for acute severe ulcerative colitis. Requires radiographic, laboratory, and clinical symptoms to calculate risk.

Medium Description En: Predicts risk of needing colectomy with severe ulcerative colitis.
Instructions En: Use this tool to predict failure of medical therapy on day 3 of admission for acute severe ulcerative colitis. Requires a lab value and clinical finding to calculate risk.

Full Title En: Predicting Risk of Cardiovascular Disease EVENTs (PREVENT)
Medium Description En: Predicts risk for incident CVD and CVD subtypes.
Instructions En: This tool is an update to the AHA/ACC Pooled Cohort Equations previously published in 2013. It now includes BMI, has expanded the age for which scores can be calculated, and excludes race. Additionally, it includes optional variables that better define the effect of cardiovascular-kidney-metabolic (CKM) conditions. Finally, it can provide risk estimates of total CVD along with subtypes including ASCVD, heart failure, coronary heart disease, and stroke.
Before Use: Additional validation work is ongoing as of January 2024. Updates will be added here as they are published.

Full Title En: International Ovarian Tumor Analysis (IOTA) Simple Rules Risk Assessment
Medium Description En: Predicts risk of malignancy in adnexal masses using ultrasound features.
Instructions En: This tool provides an estimated risk of malignancy in patients who are undergoing adnexal surgery.

Full Title En: HIV Incidence Risk Index for MSM (HIRI-MSM)
Medium Description En: Identifies MSM at risk of HIV infection.
Instructions En: This questionnaire can be used to determine risk of acquiring HIV by men who have sex with men (MSM).

Medium Description En: Quantifies the amount of disability due to headache-related symptoms.
Identifies children at very low risk of clinically important blunt abdominal injuries.
Instructions En: Use in patients <18 years old presenting with blunt abdominal trauma within 24 hours of injury. Do not use in patients with penetrating trauma, pre-existing neurologic disorders impeding a reliable exam, or pregnancy. Do not use in patients transferred from another hospital where abdominal CT or diagnostic peritoneal lavage was already performed.
Short Description En: Rules out clinically important blunt abdominal injuries.

Medium Description En: Assesses disability in patients with neck pain.
